DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to elaborate a multi-dimensional indicator of the quality in palliative care for patients of end-of-life. The study will, as secondary objectives: - elaborate in a standard manner one set of indicators of organization and inner working of a palliative care setting. - compare according to these indicators, the qualities of 3 types of palliative care: palliative care unit in hospitals, specified identified bed for palliative care patients and non-specified bed. - explore the relationship between organizational aspects and results in term of burden.
DOC.brief_title: Elaboration of a Multi-dimensional Indicator of Quality in Palliative Care
DOC.detailed_description: A multicentric study aims on quality of palliative care and will be conducted in three types of 7 palliative care settings: two hospices, two hospital-based palliative care units and three medical units where a mobile palliative care team intervenes.
